name: Pumpkin Ale Braised Pork
description: This method of slow-cooking is called “braising” and it’s a great way of cooking with liquids to make tougher cuts of meat tasty and fork tender.
preparation: In a large bowl, combine pork, ale, and seasonings.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Remove pork from ale mixture and sear until brown on all sides.
Add ale mixture and vegetables to pot. Cover and simmer on low for 1–1 1⁄2 hours.
Season with Salt and Pepper to taste and serve.
